meanings.definition: Fighting or quarreling in a loud and aggressive way.
meanings.sent1: The brawling dogs scared the neighbors with their loud fighting.
meanings.sent2: The brawling siblings were always causing trouble in the house.
meanings.sent3: The brawling birds outside my window sounded like a rowdy concert.
meanings.sent4: The brawling storm clouds clashed in the sky, creating a dramatic scene.
meanings.sent5: The brawling wrestlers in the ring entertained the crowd with their intense match.

meanings.sent1: He was brawling with his opponent in the boxing match.
meanings.sent2: The kids were brawling over the last piece of candy.
meanings.sent3: The two cats were brawling over a toy mouse, making a funny scene.
meanings.sent4: The waves brawling against the rocks showed the power of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The knights brawling in the jousting tournament displayed their strength and skill.

meanings.sent1: The brawling crowd at the concert made it hard to hear the music.
meanings.sent2: The brawling students in the hallway disrupted the class next door.
meanings.sent3: The brawling monkeys in the zoo enclosure were quite a spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The brawling colors in the painting clashed in a chaotic yet intriguing way.
meanings.sent5: The brawling traffic on the highway slowed down the journey significantly.
